page.title: 06FARMS NEAR PETERSFIELD 1
page.content:
At{Oakhurst}farm it was mostly Dairy. The 90 cows are milked in the morning and evening. In the milking parlour each cow has its own cubicle with hay and cow-salt. The farmer milks 8 cows at a time. A Unigate lorry comes to collect the milk. A pipe is stuck in the side of the wall and the milk pumped into the lorry. The cows know roughly when milking time is and they line up by the electric fence.
{Lords}farm has 48 acres and on most of the land the farm grows barley and potatoes. He has only 4 fields. The greenhouses have cucumbers, tomatoes and pepper plants which are kept in a high temperature. He sells his produce to local shops.
